page.title: 06EPPERSTONE PLAYGROUP
page.content: Twelve children of 2yrs and upwards attend together with mothers and toddlers,i.e.under 2yrs.Three sessions are held each week in the Social Institute.Typical {activities}include painting,collage,model_making,dressing _up,jig_saws,story_telling,rhymes, games and songs.Children also play outside with water,sand and tricycles when weather permits.A sponsored sun_ flower growing competition is in progress to raise funds for the group. {W.E.A.}evening classes for adults are held once weekly during the Autumn and Spring terms.The average number attending is 15_mainly drawn from Epperstone and Woodborough. Wildlife and wild flowers are this year's studies.In the past courses on other subjects have been held,but Natural History is the most popular.
